channel.title: First Template!
channel.description:
Hey guys I just wanted to release my FIRST template ever! I know it might not be amazing ,or to some of you it might even be good but just tell me what you think!
By the way there is a very basic login system file in the file. Its called membershipSITE. To get it working you have to make a database and make a table in phpAdmin or whatever its called! (No its not implemented into the template) In my next template Il implement the login system!
Also Tips would be very appreciated!! :D
Download - [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?8b6r5pd7326qf4h]http://www.mediafire.com/?8b6r5pd7326qf4h[/url]
[img]http://imageshack.us/scaled/landing/341/sitegn.png[/img]
[img]http://imageshack.us/scaled/landing/268/site1o.png[/img]
Sorry about the pictures there bad :p
Download Link - [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?8b6r5pd7326qf4h]http://www.mediafire.com/?8b6r5pd7326qf4h[/url] Download Link - [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?8b6r5pd7326qf4h]http://www.mediafire.com/?8b6r5pd7326qf4h[/url]

item.title: First Template!
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

Could someone tell me how to make a new page leading from like vote?

Read full topic

item.title: First Template!
item.dc:creator: @robonick8 robonick8
item.description:
@robonick8 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:463524”][quote author=Sibor link=topic=567017.msg4121215#msg4121215 date=1349743268]
It’s not too bad but you shouls learn how to use “padding”. It will make your work better. Check out w3schools.com
[/quote]

Don’t use w3schools, most if their information is complete crap.

I didn’t download it but just going by the .html suffix everything below is assumed.

I also generally like this template but instead of manually adding the news though, why not integrate it to the SMF SSI and use the boardNews(); function? If you did integrate the SSI you could also take that login form in the left and make use of it through the forums by using the ssi_login(); function. I’m not a fan of the flames, they don’t fit with the grey and white theme.

Overall good job you also should’ve posted this in the website development section.[/quote]

Why thank you and thank you for the tips! I will take all those tips and research them. Next template i will add them!!

Read full topic

item.title: First Template!
item.dc:creator: @Broken-Reality Broken-Reality
item.description:
@Broken-Reality wrote:

Sorry, i don’t like this -.-

Read full topic

item.title: First Template!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Sibor:

It’s not too bad but you shouls learn how to use “padding”. It will make your work better. Check out w3schools.com

Don’t use w3schools, most if their information is complete crap.

I didn’t download it but just going by the .html suffix everything below is assumed.

I also generally like this template but instead of manually adding the news though, why not integrate it to the SMF SSI and use the boardNews(); function? If you did integrate the SSI you could also take that login form in the left and make use of it through the forums by using the ssi_login(); function. I’m not a fan of the flames, they don’t fit with the grey and white theme.

Overall good job you also should’ve posted this in the website development section.

Read full topic
